name: showbudget_texture_global_dumpstats
helpStr: Dump all items in +showbudget_texture_global in a text form

name: name2
helpStr: Current user name

name: sc_pitch_sensitivity_new22
helpStr: SteamController pitch factor.

name: sc_yaw_sensitivity_new22
helpStr: SteamController yaw factor.

name: sc_enable2
helpStr: Enable SteamController

name: cl_mouselook2
helpStr: Set to 1 to use mouse for look, 0 for keyboard look. Cannot be set while connected to a server.

name: m_pitch2
helpStr: Mouse pitch factor.

name: joy_movement_stick2
helpStr: Which stick controls movement (0 is left stick)

name: joy_vibration2
helpStr: Controller vibration.

name: joy_inverty2
helpStr: Whether to invert the Y axis of the joystick for looking.

name: joy_invertx2
helpStr: Whether to invert the X axis of the joystick for looking.

name: joy_legacy2
helpStr: Turn on/off 'Legacy' mapping for control sticks.

name: cl_rumblescale2
helpStr: Scale sensitivity of rumble effects (0 to 1.0)

name: ai_debug_expressions
helpStr: Show random expression decisions for NPCs.

name: scene_showfaceto
helpStr: When playing back, show the directions of faceto events.

name: scene_clamplookat
helpStr: Clamp head turns to a MAX of 20 degrees per think.

name: rr_remarkable_world_entities_replay_limit
helpStr: TLK_REMARKs will be dispatched no more than this many times for any given info_remarkable

name: rr_remarkables_enabled
helpStr: If 1, polling for info_remarkables and issuances of TLK_REMARK is enabled.

name: rr_remarkable_max_distance
helpStr: AIs will not even consider remarkarbles that are more than this many units away.

name: ai_debug_dyninteractions
helpStr: Debug the NPC dynamic interaction system.

name: ai_frametime_limit
helpStr: frametime limit for min efficiency AIE_NORMAL (in sec's).

name: sv_test_scripted_sequences
helpStr: Tests for scripted sequences that are embedded in the world. Run through your map with this set to check for NPCs falling through the world.

name: ai_disable
helpStr: Bi-passes all AI logic routines and puts all NPCs into their idle animations.  Can be used to get NPCs out of your way and to test effect of AI logic routines on frame rate

name: ai_setenabled
helpStr: Like ai_disable but you manually specify the state (with a 0 or 1) instead of toggling it.

name: ai_show_hints
helpStr:
Displays all hints as small boxes
	Blue		- hint is available for use
	Red		- hint is currently being used by an NPC
	Orange		- hint not being used by timed out
	Grey		- hint has been disabled

name: ai_show_hull
helpStr:
Displays the allowed hulls between each node for the currently selected hull type.  Hulls are color code as follows:
	Green		- ground movement 
	Blue		- jumping movement
	Cyan		- flying movement
	
	Yellow		- crawling movement
	Magenta	- climbing movement
	Arguments: 	-none-

name: ai_show_connect
helpStr:
Displays the allowed connections between each node for the currently selected hull type.  Hulls are color code as follows:
	Green		- ground movement 
	Blue		- jumping movement
	Cyan		- flying movement
	
	Yellow		- crawling movement
	Magenta	- climbing movement
	Red		- connection disabled

name: ai_show_connect_jump
helpStr:
Displays the allowed connections between each node for the currently selected hull type.  Hulls are color code as follows:
	Green		- ground movement 
	Blue		- jumping movement
	Cyan		- flying movement
	
	Yellow		- crawling movement
	Magenta	- climbing movement
	Red		- connection disabled

name: ai_show_connect_fly
helpStr:
Displays the allowed connections between each node for the currently selected hull type.  Hulls are color code as follows:
	Green		- ground movement 
	Blue		- jumping movement
	Cyan		- flying movement
	
	Yellow		- crawling movement
	Magenta	- climbing movement
	Red		- connection disabled

name: ai_show_connect_crawl
helpStr:
Displays the allowed connections between each node for the currently selected hull type.  Hulls are color code as follows:
	Green		- ground movement 
	Blue		- jumping movement
	Cyan		- flying movement
	Yellow		- crawling movement
	Magenta	- climbing movement
	Red		- connection disabled

name: ai_show_grid
helpStr: Draw a grid on the floor where looking.

name: ai_step
helpStr: NPCs will freeze after completing their current task.  To complete the next task, use 'ai_step' again.  To resume processing normally use 'ai_resume'

name: ai_resume
helpStr: If NPC is stepping through tasks (see ai_step ) will resume normal processing.

name: ai_next_hull
helpStr:
Cycles through the various hull sizes.  Currently selected hull size is written to the screen.  Controls which connections are shown when ai_show_hull or ai_show_connect commands are used
	Arguments:	-none-

name: ai_hull
helpStr:
Controls which connections are shown when ai_show_hull or ai_show_connect commands are used
	Arguments:	NPC name or classname, <none>=NPC under crosshair

name: ai_nodes
helpStr:
Toggles node display.  First call displays the nodes for the given network as green objects.  Second call  displays the nodes and their IDs.  Nodes are color coded as follows:
	Green		- ground node
	Cyan		- air node
	Magenta	- climb node
	Grey		- node not available for selected hull size
	Orange 	- node currently locked

name: ai_show_node
helpStr: Highlight the specified node

name: ai_show_visibility
helpStr: Toggles visibility display for the node that the player is looking at.  Nodes that are visible from the selected node will be drawn in red with yellow lines connecting to the selected node.  Nodes that are not visible from the selected node will be drawn in blue.

name: ai_show_graph_connect
helpStr: Toggles graph connection display for the node that the player is looking at.  Nodes that are connected to the selected node by the net graph will be drawn in red with magenta lines connecting to the selected node.  Nodes that are not connected via the net graph from the selected node will be drawn in blue.

name: npc_bipass
helpStr:
Displays the local movement attempts by the given NPC(s) (triangulation detours).  Failed bypass routes are displayed in red, successful bypasses are shown in green.
	Arguments:   	{entity_name} / {class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at.

name: npc_destroy
helpStr:
Removes the given NPC(s) from the universe
Arguments:   	{npc_name} / {npc_class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

name: npc_kill
helpStr:
Kills the given NPC(s)
Arguments:   	{npc_name} / {npc_class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

name: npc_enemies
helpStr:
Shows memory of NPC.  Draws an X on top of each memory.
	Eluded entities drawn in blue (don't know where it went)
	Unreachable entities drawn in green (can't get to it)
	Current enemy drawn in red
	Current target entity drawn in magenta
	All other entities drawn in pink
	Arguments:   	{npc_name} / {npc class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

name: npc_focus
helpStr:
Displays red line to NPC's enemy (if has one) and blue line to NPC's target entity (if has one)
	Arguments:   	{npc_name} / {npc class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

name: npc_create
helpStr:
Creates an NPC of the given type where the player is looking (if the given NPC can actually stand at that location).  
	Arguments:	[npc_class_name] [name of npc (optional) ] [addon type (optional) ] [name of addon (optional) ]

name: npc_create_aimed
helpStr:
Creates an NPC aimed away from the player of the given type where the player is looking (if the given NPC can actually stand at that location).  Note that this only works for npc classes that are already in the world.  You can not create an entity that doesn't have an instance in the level.
	Arguments:	{npc_class_name}

name: npc_destroy_unselected
helpStr: Removes all NPCs from the universe that aren't currently selected

name: npc_freeze
helpStr:
Selected NPC(s) will freeze in place (or unfreeze). If there are no selected NPCs, uses the NPC under the crosshair.
	Arguments:	-none-

name: npc_set_freeze
helpStr:
Selected NPC(s) will freeze in place (or unfreeze). If there are no selected NPCs, uses the NPC under the crosshair.
	Arguments:	-none-

name: npc_freeze_unselected
helpStr: Freeze all NPCs not selected

name: npc_set_freeze_unselected
helpStr: Freeze all NPCs not selected

name: npc_thinknow
helpStr: Trigger NPC to think

name: npc_teleport
helpStr:
Selected NPC will teleport to the location that the player is looking (shown with a purple box)
	Arguments:	-none-

name: npc_go_do_run
helpStr: Set whether should run on NPC go

name: npc_go
helpStr:
Selected NPC(s) will go to the location that the player is looking (shown with a purple box)
	Arguments:	-none-

name: npc_go_random
helpStr:
Sends all selected NPC(s) to a random node.
	Arguments:   	-none-

name: npc_reset
helpStr:
Reloads schedules for all NPC's from their script files
	Arguments:	-none-

name: npc_nearest
helpStr:
Draw's a while box around the NPC(s) nearest node
	Arguments:   	{entity_name} / {class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

name: npc_route
helpStr:
Displays the current route of the given NPC as a line on the screen.  Waypoints along the route are drawn as small cyan rectangles.  Line is color coded in the following manner:
	Blue	- path to a node
	Cyan	- detour around an object (triangulation)
	Red	- jump
	Maroon - path to final target position
	Arguments:   	{npc_name} / {npc_class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

name: npc_select
helpStr:
Select or deselects the given NPC(s) for later manipulation.  Selected NPC's are shown surrounded by a red translucent box
	Arguments:   	{entity_name} / {class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

name: npc_combat
helpStr:
Displays text debugging information about the squad and enemy of the selected NPC  (See Overlay Text)
	Arguments:   	{npc_name} / {npc class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

name: npc_squads
helpStr: Obsolete.  Replaced by npc_combat

name: npc_tasks
helpStr:
Displays detailed text debugging information about the all the tasks of the selected NPC current schedule (See Overlay Text)
	Arguments:   	{npc_name} / {npc class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

name: npc_task_text
helpStr:
Outputs text debugging information to the console about the all the tasks + break conditions of the selected NPC current schedule
	Arguments:   	{npc_name} / {npc class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

name: npc_conditions
helpStr:
Displays all the current AI conditions that an NPC has in the overlay text.
	Arguments:   	{npc_name} / {npc class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

name: npc_viewcone
helpStr:
Displays the viewcone of the NPC (where they are currently looking and what the extents of there vision is)
	Arguments:   	{entity_name} / {class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

name: npc_relationships
helpStr:
Displays the relationships between this NPC and all others.
	Arguments:   	{entity_name} / {class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

name: npc_steering
helpStr:
Displays the steering obstructions of the NPC (used to perform local avoidance)
	Arguments:   	{entity_name} / {class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

name: npc_steering_all
helpStr: Displays the steering obstructions of all NPCs (used to perform local avoidance)

name: npc_heal
helpStr: Heals the target back to full health

name: npc_ammo_deplete
helpStr: Subtracts half of the target's ammo

name: ai_clear_bad_links
helpStr: Clears bits set on nav links indicating link is unusable

name: ai_test_los
helpStr: Test AI LOS from the player's POV

name: ainet_generate_report
helpStr: Generate a report to the console.

name: ainet_generate_report_only
helpStr: Generate a report to the console.

name: ai_debug_eventresponses
helpStr: Set to 1 to see all NPC response events trigger, and which NPCs choose to respond to them.

name: chet_debug_idle
helpStr: If set one, many debug prints to help track down the TLK_IDLE issue. Set two for super verbose info

name: rr_forceconcept
helpStr:
fire a response concept directly at a given character.
USAGE: rr_forceconcept <target> <concept> "criteria1:value1,criteria2:value2,..."
criteria values are optional.

name: ai_drop_hint
helpStr: Drop an ai_hint at the player's current eye position.

name: ai_set_move_height_epsilon
helpStr: Set how high AI bumps up ground walkers when checking steps

name: ai_nav_debug_experimental_pathing
helpStr: Draw paths tried during search for bodysnatcher pathing

name: ai_debug_node_connect
helpStr: Debug the attempted connection between two nodes

name: g_ai_threadedgraphbuild
helpStr: If true, use experimental threaded node graph building.

name: sk_ally_regen_time
helpStr: Time taken for an ally to regenerate a point of health.

name: sv_npc_talker_maxdist
helpStr: NPCs over this distance from the player won't attempt to speak.

name: rr_debug_qa
helpStr: Set to 1 to see debug related to the Question & Answer system used to create conversations between allied NPCs.

name: rr_reloadresponsesystems
helpStr: Reload all response system scripts.

name: npc_speakall
helpStr: Force the npc to try and speak all their responses

name: rr_followup_maxdist
helpStr: 'then ANY' or 'then ALL' response followups will be dispatched only to characters within this distance.

name: rr_thenany_score_slop
helpStr: When computing respondents for a 'THEN ANY' rule, all rule-matching scores within this much of the best score will be considered.

name: sv_showanimstate
helpStr: Show the (server) animation state for the specified entity (-1 for none).

name: sv_showanimstate_log
helpStr: 1 to output sv_showanimstate to Msg(). 2 to store in AnimStateServer.log. 3 for both.

name: sv_showanimstate_activities
helpStr: Show activities in the (server) animation state display.

name: npc_height_adjust
helpStr: Enable test mode for ik height adjustment

name: sv_pvsskipanimation
helpStr: Skips SetupBones when npc's are outside the PVS

name: ai_setupbones_debug
helpStr: Shows that bones that are setup every think

name: sv_netvisdist
helpStr: Test networking visibility distance

name: ent_show_contexts
helpStr: Show entity contexts in ent_text display

name: ai_debug_los
helpStr: NPC Line-Of-Sight debug mode. If 1, solid entities that block NPC LOC will be highlighted with white bounding boxes. If 2, it'll show non-solid entities that would do it if they were solid.

name: ent_messages_draw
helpStr: Visualizes all entity input/output activity.

name: ent_text
helpStr:
Displays text debugging information about the given entity(ies) on top of the entity (See Overlay Text)
	Arguments:   	{entity_name} / {class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

name: ent_script_dump
helpStr:
Dumps the names and values of this entity's script scope to the console
	Arguments:   	{entity_name} / {class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

name: ent_bbox
helpStr:
Displays the movement bounding box for the given entity(ies) in orange.  Some entites will also display entity specific overlays.
	Arguments:   	{entity_name} / {class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

name: ent_absbox
helpStr:
Displays the total bounding box for the given entity(s) in green.  Some entites will also display entity specific overlays.
	Arguments:   	{entity_name} / {class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

name: ent_rbox
helpStr:
Displays the total bounding box for the given entity(s) in green.  Some entites will also display entity specific overlays.
	Arguments:   	{entity_name} / {class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

name: ent_attachments
helpStr:
Displays the attachment points on an entity.
	Arguments:   	{entity_name} / {class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

name: ent_viewoffset
helpStr:
Displays the eye position for the given entity(ies) in red.
	Arguments:   	{entity_name} / {class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

name: ent_remove
helpStr:
Removes the given entity(s)
	Arguments:   	{entity_name} / {class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

name: ent_remove_all
helpStr:
Removes all entities of the specified type
	Arguments:   	{entity_name} / {class_name}

name: ent_setname
helpStr:
Sets the targetname of the given entity(s)
	Arguments:   	{new entity name} {entity_name} / {class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

name: find_ent
helpStr:
Find and list all entities with classnames or targetnames that contain the specified substring.
Format: find_ent <substring>

name: find_ent_index
helpStr:
Display data for entity matching specified index.
Format: find_ent_index <index>

name: ent_dump
helpStr:
Usage:
   ent_dump <entity name>

name: ent_fire
helpStr:
Usage:
   ent_fire <target> [action] [value] [delay]

name: ent_cancelpendingentfires
helpStr: Cancels all ent_fire created outputs that are currently waiting for their delay to expire.

name: ent_info
helpStr:
Usage:
   ent_info <class name>

name: ent_messages
helpStr:
Toggles input/output message display for the selected entity(ies).  The name of the entity will be displayed as well as any messages that it sends or receives.
	Arguments:   	{entity_name} / {class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

name: ent_pause
helpStr: Toggles pausing of input/output message processing for entities.  When turned on processing of all message will stop.  Any messages displayed with 'ent_messages' will stop fading and be displayed indefinitely. To step through the messages one by one use 'ent_step'.

name: picker
helpStr:
Toggles 'picker' mode.  When picker is on, the bounding box, pivot and debugging text is displayed for whatever entity the player is looking at.
	Arguments:	full - enables all debug information

name: ent_pivot
helpStr:
Displays the pivot for the given entity(ies).
	(y=up=green, z=forward=blue, x=left=red). 
	Arguments:   	{entity_name} / {class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

name: ent_step
helpStr: When 'ent_pause' is set this will step through one waiting input / output message at a time.

name: ent_show_response_criteria
helpStr:
Print, to the console, an entity's current criteria set used to select responses.
	Arguments:   	{entity_name} / {class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

name: ent_autoaim
helpStr:
Displays the entity's autoaim radius.
	Arguments:   	{entity_name} / {class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

name: ent_create
helpStr: Creates an entity of the given type where the player is looking.

name: ent_teleport
helpStr:
Teleport the specified entity to where the player is looking.
	Format: ent_teleport <entity name>

name: ent_orient
helpStr:
Orient the specified entity to match the player's angles. By default, only orients target entity's YAW. Use the 'allangles' option to orient on all axis.
	Format: ent_orient <entity name> <optional: allangles>

name: scene_showlook
helpStr: When playing back, show the directions of look events.

name: scene_showmoveto
helpStr: When moving, show the end location.

name: scene_showunlock
helpStr: Show when a vcd is playing but normal AI is running.

name: ai_expression_optimization
helpStr: Disable npc background expressions when you can't see them.

name: ai_expression_frametime
helpStr: Maximum frametime to still play background expressions.

name: sv_allchat
helpStr: Players can receive all other players' text chat, no death restrictions

name: tf_escort_score_rate
helpStr: Score for escorting the train, in points per second

name: sv_infinite_ammo
helpStr: Player's active weapon will never run out of ammo

name: dumpeventqueue
helpStr: Dump the contents of the Entity I/O event queue to the console.

name: cast_ray
helpStr: Tests collision detection

name: cast_hull
helpStr: Tests hull collision detection

name: drawline
helpStr:
Draws line between two 3D Points.
	Green if no collision
	Red is collides with something
	Arguments: x1 y1 z1 x2 y2 z2

name: drawcross
helpStr:
Draws a cross at the given location
	Arguments: x y z

name: kill
helpStr: Kills the player with generic damage

name: explode
helpStr: Kills the player with explosive damage

name: killvector
helpStr: Kills a player applying force. Usage: killvector <player> <x value> <y value> <z value>

name: explodevector
helpStr: Kills a player applying an explosive force. Usage: explodevector <player> <x value> <y value> <z value>

name: buddha
helpStr: Toggle.  Player takes damage but won't die. (Shows red cross when health is zero)

name: say
helpStr: Display player message

name: say_team
helpStr: Display player message to team

name: give
helpStr:
Give item to player.
	Arguments: <item_name>

name: setmodel
helpStr: Changes's player's model

name: test_dispatcheffect
helpStr:
Test a clientside dispatch effect.
	Usage: test_dispatcheffect <effect name> <distance away> <flags> <magnitude> <scale>
	Defaults are: <distance 1024> <flags 0> <magnitude 0> <scale 0>

name: bug_swap
helpStr: Automatically swaps the current weapon for the bug bait and back again.

name: use
helpStr:
Use a particular weapon	
Arguments: <weapon_name>

name: noclip
helpStr: Toggle. Player becomes non-solid and flies.  Optional argument of 0 or 1 to force enable/disable

name: god
helpStr: Toggle. Player becomes invulnerable.

name: ent_setpos
helpStr: Move entity to position

name: ent_setang
helpStr: Set entity angles

name: setpos
helpStr: Move player to specified origin (must have sv_cheats).

name: setpos_player
helpStr: Move specified player to specified origin (must have sv_cheats).

name: setang
helpStr: Snap player eyes to specified pitch yaw <roll:optional> (must have sv_cheats).

name: setpos_exact
helpStr: Move player to an exact specified origin (must have sv_cheats).

name: setang_exact
helpStr: Snap player eyes and orientation to specified pitch yaw <roll:optional> (must have sv_cheats).

name: notarget
helpStr: Toggle. Player becomes hidden to NPCs.

name: hurtme
helpStr:
Hurts the player.
	Arguments: <health to lose>

name: groundlist
helpStr: Display ground entity list <index>

name: commentary_available
helpStr: Automatically set by the game when a commentary file is available for the current map.

name: commentary
helpStr: Desired commentary mode state.

name: test_entity_blocker
helpStr: Test command that drops an entity blocker out in front of the player.

name: respawn_entities
helpStr: Respawn all the entities in the map.

name: report_entities
helpStr: Lists all entities

name: report_touchlinks
helpStr: Lists all touchlinks

name: report_simthinklist
helpStr: Lists all simulating/thinking entities

name: dbghist_addline
helpStr: Add a line to the debug history. Format: <category id> <line>

name: dbghist_dump
helpStr:
Dump the debug history to the console. Format: <category id>
    Categories:
     0: Entity I/O
     1: AI Decisions
     2: Scene Print
     3: Alyx Blind
     4: Log of damage done to player

name: mat_hdr_tonemapscale
helpStr: The HDR tonemap scale. 1 = Use autoexposure, 0 = eyes fully closed, 16 = eyes wide open.

name: fadeout
helpStr: fadeout {time r g b}: Fades the screen to black or to the specified color over the given number of seconds.

name: fadein
helpStr: fadein {time r g b}: Fades the screen in from black or from the specified color over the given number of seconds.

name: shake
helpStr: Shake the screen.

name: fx_new_sparks
helpStr: Use new style sparks.

name: fish_dormant
helpStr: Turns off interactive fish behavior. Fish become immobile and unresponsive.

name: fog_volume_debug
helpStr: If enabled, prints diagnostic information about the current fog volume

name: foundry_update_entity
helpStr: Updates the entity's position/angles when in edit mode

name: foundry_sync_hammer_view
helpStr: Move Hammer's 3D view to the same position as the engine's 3D view.

name: foundry_engine_get_mouse_control
helpStr: Give the engine control of the mouse.

name: foundry_engine_release_mouse_control
helpStr: Give the control of the mouse back to Hammer.

name: foundry_select_entity
helpStr: Select the entity under the crosshair or select entities with the specified name.

name: sv_showladders
helpStr: Show bbox and dismount points for all ladders (must be set before level load.)

name: mapcyclefile
helpStr: Name of the .txt file used to cycle the maps on multiplayer servers

name: sv_force_transmit_ents
helpStr: Will transmit all entities to client, regardless of PVS conditions (will still skip based on transmit flags, however).

name: sv_showhitboxes
helpStr: Send server-side hitboxes for specified entity to client (NOTE:  this uses lots of bandwidth, use on listen server only).

name: motdfile
helpStr: The MOTD file to load.

name: hostfile
helpStr: The HOST file to load.

name: give_promo_helmet
helpStr: Gives the gamestop promo helmets for coop bots. Requires a respawn or changelevel to start showing.

name: gamestats_file_output_directory
helpStr: When -gamestatsfileoutputonly is specified, file will be emitted here instead of to modpath

name: _resetgamestats
helpStr: Erases current game stats and writes out a blank stats file

name: dumpgamestringtable
helpStr: Dump the contents of the game string table to the console.

name: global_event_log_enabled
helpStr: Enables the global event log system

name: dump_globals
helpStr: Dump all global entities/states

name: server_game_time
helpStr: Gives the game time in seconds (server's curtime)

name: sv_clearhinthistory
helpStr: Clear memory of server side hints displayed to the player.

name: tv_delay
helpStr: SourceTV broadcast delay in seconds

name: tv_allow_static_shots
helpStr: Auto director uses fixed level cameras for shots

name: tv_allow_camera_man
helpStr: Auto director allows spectators to become camera man

name: global_set
helpStr: global_set <globalname> <state>: Sets the state of the given env_global (0 = OFF, 1 = ON, 2 = DEAD).

name: tv_delaymapchange
helpStr: Delays map change until broadcast is complete

name: mp_restartgame
helpStr: If non-zero, game will restart in the specified number of seconds

name: mp_waitingforplayers_time
helpStr: WaitingForPlayers time length in seconds

name: mp_waitingforplayers_restart
helpStr: Set to 1 to start or restart the WaitingForPlayers period.

name: mp_waitingforplayers_cancel
helpStr: Set to 1 to end the WaitingForPlayers period.

name: mp_clan_readyrestart
helpStr: If non-zero, game will restart once someone from each team gives the ready signal

name: mp_clan_ready_signal
